Amazingly at a London auction last week I purchased what I think is a late =
Muromachi/Momoyama period nagamaki in its original koshirae. The heavy 32.7=
5" blade is unsigned but inscribed =92ichi=92 as are the yamagane fuchi, ko=
i-guchi and one seppa, the open end of the tsuka is similarly marked in ink=
 under the fuchi. The tsuba is 16th century Tachi-kanagushi work lacquered =
red and may be original to the mounting.

The blade is too discoloured to s=
ee any details but it has ububa of 7" and the edge side of the habaki has a=
 slot cut into it to allow for this.  

I assume this is the first of a gro=
up of similarly mounted weapons ordered by a clan or Temple. I think that t=
he sword has been kept in storage for a very long time as it is not for eve=
ryday use, weighing around 6lbs and is 4'7" long overall and is in mostly g=
ood condition but with worm holes in the leather bound tsuka

I would like =
to know if anyone on the list has seen a similarly mounted nagamaki, the bl=
ack sam=E9 and red lacquered binding are distinctive. I would like to know =
where it came from.

I have uploaded images at:
http://www.esnips.com/web/T=
subaFittings
